q:
To keep the track of your daily sales transactions, you need to create a database 'sales' while working with MongoDB. Before creating the database, you must check for the names of existing databases to prevent failure while creating a new database.
You need to perform the following commands:
1. Create the database 'sales'
2. Find the name of the current database that you are using
3. Create a collection 'orders' in the database
4. Delete the collection 'Orders' and also delete the database 'sales'
Which of the following shows the correct set of commands to perform the above operations using MongoShell?

Options

1.

> sh db
> create database sales
> use sales
> sales.createCollection("orders")
> sales.deleteCollection() 
> dropDatabase()

2.

> show alldatabases
> use sales
> currentdb()
> sales.newCollection("orders")
> sales.collection.drop() 
> sales.dropDatabase()

3.

> show databases
> use sales
> db
> db.createCollection("orders")
> db.orders.drop() 
> db.dropDatabase()

4.

> show databases
> use sales
> db
> db.createCollection("orders")
> drop collection orders
> drop database sales
You have a MongoDB instance running on localhost at non-default port 27019. You want to connect with this instance. Which of the following commands will you use to connect with this MongoDB instance?

You have a database 'library' built using MongoDB. You need to perform the following operations on the database. You need to find out the names of the existing collections in the database 'library', create a collection 'books' in a database 'library' and in collection 'books', add the documents with the values given below. You need to search for the document with the key-value pair 'book- Clean code' and then print the data of all documents in a human-readable format.
Documents
{ "book": "Clean code", "author": "Robert Martin" }
{ "book": "Refactoring","author":"Martin Fowler"}
Which of the following shows the correct set of commands to perform the above operations using MongoShell?

Options

1.

> use library
> show db.collections
> db.collections.insert({" book" :"Clean code", "author":"Robert Martin"}, {"book":"Refactoring","author":"Martin Fowler"})
> db.document.find({" book" :"Clean code"})
> db.document.find().hprint()

2.

> use library
> show collections
> db.books.insertMany([{" book" :"Clean code", "author":"Robert Martin"}, {"book":"Refactoring","author":"Martin Fowler"}])
> db.books.find({" book" :"Clean code"})
> db.books.find().pretty()

3.

> use library
> db collections
> db.collections.insertMany([{" book" :"Clean code", "author":"Robert Martin"}, {"book":" Refactoring","author":"Martin Fowler"}])
> db.books.get({" book" :"Clean code"})
> db.books.print().pretty()

4.

> use library
> show collections
> db.books.insertValues([{" book" :"Clean code", "author":"Robert Martin"}, {"book":"Refactoring","author":"Martin Fowler"}])
> db.books.find({" book" :"Clean code"})
> db.books.find().val()

What will be the output for below mention shell script 

$ [ 5 -lt 10 ]; echo $?

What will be the output for below mention shell script 

$ test 5 -eq 10; echo $?
Which one is not a mode of UNIX Vi editor
In Unix Vi editor, Ex mode is also known as ________
Which shell is considered as default shell in UNIX shell programming
UNIX operating system uses an interface to interact with user and kernel. The name of the interface is _________________

In Shell Scripting, which of the following statements about the shell are correct:
1. It interprets the command and calls the program that is required when you execute any Linux command in your terminal.
2. C Shell, Bourne Shell, and Bash are the most commonly used shells in the Linux environment.
